title: Linux package managers
description: A collection of common Linux commands categorized by functionality.

categories.description: APT is a command-line package manager that provides commands for managing, searching, and retrieving information about packages. It has the same functionalities as specific APT tools (such as apt-get and apt-cache), enabling additional options that are useful for interactive use.

Perform a full system upgrade by removing, installing, and updating packages

categories.description: A set of commands for managing, installing, updating, and removing software packages on Linux-based systems. These commands allow users to perform package operations in an efficient and controlled manner.
